Notably, the study also reveals that the WHO case definition does not show 100% sensitivity.
1 About 18% of patients with suspected disease who did not fulfil the case definition were confirmed to have the disease by laboratory testing. Unfortunately, the study does not disclose the clinical or epidemiological characteristics of these patients, although the sensitivity increased when fever was not a mandatory criterion. Health-care workers who have seen many patients with Ebola virus disease probably have a better chance of suspecting the infection than a list of criteria.
